processcsv package

Submodules

processcsv.groupby_col module

processcsv.groupby_col.group_by_col_sum(base_dir: str, in_pathfilename: str, out_folder: str, filename: str, group_by: List[str])[source]

Sum a column which normally is ‘amount’ with predefined conditions, the conditions are normally values in one or more columns.

Parameters:

  • base_dir (str) – parent directory of the file

  • in_pathfilename (str) – the csv file to be grouped by, directory under basedir plus file name

  • out_folder (str) – the dirto hold the processed csv file

  • filename (str) – a name for the processed csv file to be saved

  • group_by (List[str]) – a list of columns as grouped by conditions

processcsv.lookupcsv module

processcsv.lookupcsv.dict_val(f: str, key_cols: str, val_col: any)[source]

Populate a new dictionary from a csv file with predefined columns

Parameters:

  • f (str) – the source csv file

  • key_cols (a tuple of str) – the columns selected to form the dictionary’s key

  • val_col (float or any) – the value to be compared, mostly ‘amount’

Returns:

a dictionary with a tuple of columns as key and value as the val_col

Return type:

dictionary

processcsv.lookupcsv.differs(f1: str, key_cols_1: List[str], val_col_1: any, f2: str, key_cols_2: List[str], val_col_2: any, f3: str, f4: str, f5: str)[source]
Compare two csv files - file1 and file2, with selected columns.

write the items exist in both files to a csv file f3 write the items exist in f1 not in f2 to f4, write the items exist in f2 not in f1 to f5

Parameters:

  • f1 (str) – source csv file

  • key_cols_1 (List[str]) – the column’s names which are selected to be compared

  • val_col_1 (float or any) – the value to be compared, mostly ‘amount’

  • f2 (str) – target csv file to be compared with f1

  • key_cols_2 (List[str]) – the column’s names which are selected to be compared

  • val_col_2 (float or any) – the value to be compared, mostly ‘amount’

  • f3 (str) – csv file to hold items both in f1 and f2

  • f4 (str) – items in f1 not in f2

  • f5 (str) – items in f2 not in f1

processcsv.splitcsv module

processcsv.splitcsv.split_csv(in_file: str, split_folder, out_file_name, delete_infile=True)[source]

split a csv file with a header into different csv files based on the value in the first column.

Parameters:

  • in_file (str) – the csv file to be split

  • split_folder (str) – directory to hold the split files

  • out_file_name (str) – the file name to hold content of the csv file with same values in first column

processcsv.unique_items module

processcsv.unique_items.divid_100(number)[source]
processcsv.unique_items.unique_items(base_dir, in_pathfilename, out_folder, cols=None)[source]

Find unique items in a column in a csv file if column name(s) specified; if no column(s) specified, provide csv file with unique items for every column.

Parameters:

  • base_dir (str) – parent directory of the csv file

  • in_pathfilename (str) – the path within the basedir and the csv file name

  • out_folder (str) – dir for output files

  • cols (List, optional) – the columns which need to find their unique items
